title: Double Whammy Type ID
content:
Hi everyone,

Is it OK to ask for two type IDs?

If so, any clues as to what these typefaces might be:

Many thanks for any suggestions.

Fred.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [createshape.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829181441/http:/typophile.com/files/createshape.jpg) | 16.07 KB |
| [tenn3cv.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829181441/http:/typophile.com/files/tenn3cv.jpg) | 10.34 KB |

 [‹ Hebrew classic font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829181441/http:/typophile.com/node/45175 "Go to previous forum topic") [ATLANTIC RECORDS multiple FONT ID's ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829181441/http:/typophile.com/node/45168 "Go to next forum topic")
author: fredgassit

comments.content:
Second one reminds me of Arial Narrow Bold, but to many Photoshop filters for me to tell for sure.o

p@

Dunno, but if you like this style, I recommend [Ed Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829181441/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/house_industries/ed_gothic/) and [Burbank](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829181441/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/house_industries/burbank_collection/).

I echo Stephen’s suggestions and add [Billy](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829181441/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=SPAR-BILL) and [Billy Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829181441/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=SPAR-BIBO).

the first typeface “createshape.jpg” is

bleeker regular [http://www.fontpool.com/fonts/typodermic/bleeker.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829181441/http:/www.fontpool.com/fonts/typodermic/bleeker.html "http://www.fontpool.com/fonts/typodermic/bleeker.html")

the second one like Trick mentioned has too many effects for me to tell on my monitor but if i had a guess i would say comic sans

—  
arjun

A heap of thanks to Trick, Stephen, Miss Tiffany (Hi, Miss Tiffany!) and arjun. I hope I can return the favor someday!

Fred.
